title: [Self-directed] Mastoidectomy VR Simulation Training: Intentional Practice-Based Self-Regulated Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy and understanding of otolaryngology surgical procedures
context.additional_context: Simulation training in a limited-technology environment (smartphone-based VR access), where learners engage with virtual modules replicating real surgical settings

learning_goals: Learners can identify the major anatomical boundaries of the mastoidectomy with 80% accuracy in a VR simulation environment
Learners can achieve a success rate of over 90% according to specified safety standards (protection of lateral semicircular canal, temporal bone, and facial nerve) in VR training
Learners can optimize training time using self-regulated learning tools (e.g., utilizing over 90% of allocated time) and identify at least three performance improvement areas through self-assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
